column1: 1. Who conquered most of the Arab Muslim Empire and then established a new Empire in the 11th century?
2. How did the Turks treat Christian pilgrims trying to visit the Holy Land?
column2: The Turks abused the pilgrims and would not allow them to visit the Holy Land.

column1: 3. Why did Pope Urban II call for a Crusade against the Muslim Turks?
column2: The Pope wanted Christians to visit the Holy Land and to win the Holy Land back from the Muslims.

column1: 4. What was the result of the Crusades?
column2: The Turks won, but the Christians won the right to visit the Holy Land.
The Ottoman Turks were an Asian people who conquered Arab Muslim Empires. The Turks were pagans, but converted to Islam.

The Turks invaded Europe and stole young Christian boys. The Turks trained the boys to be vicious fighters and to be Muslims. The Janissary Corps was a fierce army made up of kidnapped Christian boys.
The Turks conquered it. The Christians fled to Europe. The Turks renamed it Istanbul.

column1: 8. What did the Sultan try to do to Europe?
column2: The Sultan tried to conquer Europe and make it Muslim.

column1: 9. What was the last battle that stopped the Sultan and the Turks from conquering Europe?
